intro: Dacryodes colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian wax tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Burseraceae family and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in dry conditions. The tree produces small, fragrant flowers and is known for its hard, aromatic wood. It is often found in lowland tropical moist forests and can grow up to 20 meters tall. Its seeds are enclosed in a fleshy, yellowish fruit that attracts various bird species.
